title: Marco Arop runs world-leading 800m in season-opening win at Xiamen Diamond League
Canadian women's wheelchair basketball team books ticket to Paralympics after routing Algeria
description: Canada's women's wheelchair basketball team is Paris bound. The group punched its ticket to the 2024 Paralympics by routing Algeria 88-30 on Friday at a qualifying tournament in Osaka, Japan.

title: Historic Indigenous curling game in Cree Nation of Chisasibi aims to inspire community
description: The Cree Nation of Chisasibi, a northern Quebec town on the eastern shore of James Bay, is making history this weekend by hosting ten elite Indigenous curlers from all across Canada who will be taking to the ice for an historic game.

title: Top spot in the PWHL and attendance record at stake in latest Montreal-Toronto showdown
description: More than 21,000 fans are expected at Saturday's Montreal-Toronto game, which you can watch at 1 p.m. ET on CBC TV, CBC Gem, the CBC Sports app and CBCSports.ca.

title: Pro sports feels harsh spotlight of gambling scandals, now visible in legal market
description: With top-tier pro leagues dealing with a mounting series of gambling-related scandals, it raises the question of what, if anything, can be done to limit future episodes of this nature.

title: Celine Dion, Michael J. Fox voice their support for Canadian Olympians in new video
description: Two of Canada's biggest stars are all-in for Team Canada at this summer's Paris Olympics and are keen to tell the stories of the homegrown athletes who will be competing there.

title: Will a Canadian team finally win the Stanley Cup?
description: CBC Sports' daily newsletter previews the NHL playoffs, including the four clubs in the hunt for Canada's first Cup in 31 years.

title: Video appearing to show MLB coach inside cockpit of Toronto-bound flight prompts probe
description: Federal transportation officials in the U.S. are investigating an unauthorized in-flight cockpit visit by a coach for the Colorado Rockies baseball team during a United Airlines charter flight last week from Denver to Toronto.

title: Twins who topped Canadian females at Boston Marathon began running on northern Ontario dirt roads
description: Twin sisters Kim and Michelle Krezonoski are recovering from running the gruelling Boston Marathon after topping Canadian female finishers. Now living in Toronto, they grew up near Thunder Bay and say the pomp and circumstance of the Boston event is a far cry from their humble beginnings training on dirt roads in northern Ontario.

title: Streaking Winnipeg Jets feeling good about themselves entering playoff series with Colorado
description: The Colorado Avalanche are the 2022 Stanley Cup champions, with a lineup that features superstars Nathan MacKinnon, Cale Makar and Mikko Rantanen. But the Winnipeg Jets have home-ice advantage, the league's best goaltender and a dominant 3-0 record against their first-round opponents.

title: Canadian women's wheelchair basketball team 1 win away from Paralympic qualification
description: Canada's women's wheelchair basketball team is one win away from qualifying for the Paris Paralympics. The Canadians beat France 76-40 on Friday to finish the group stage a perfect 3-0 at their qualifying tournament in Osaka, Japan.

title: Rivalry renewed: Alberta spring signals another Oilers-Kings playoff showdown
description: There are a few sure signs of spring in Alberta. The snow turns to slush, the Canada geese return to the ponds, lakes and streams, and the Edmonton Oilers and Los Angeles Kings face each other in the first round of the Western Conference Playoffs.

title: Kristin O'Neill scores twice as PWHL Montreal completes late comeback against Minnesota
description: Kristin O'Neill scored twice, and Montreal pulled off an epic comeback for a 4-3 win over Minnesota on Thursday night in the Professional Women's Hockey League.

title: PWHL Toronto fails to clinch playoff spot in narrow loss to Boston
description: Emily Brown scored her first career goal, Susanna Tapani had a goal and an assist, and Boston returned from a 24-day international break to beat Toronto 2-1 on Thursday night.

title: Joy Drop: Excitement builds toward Paris Olympics
description: CBC Sports Senior Contributor Shireen Ahmed's weekly roundup of the things that struck her from the week that was.

title: Arizona Coyotes officially headed to Utah as sale gets final NHL approval
description: The Arizona Coyotes are officially headed to Salt Lake City. The NHL board of governors voted unanimously Thursday to approve a $1.2 billion US sale from Alex Meruelo to Utah Jazz owners Ryan and Ashley Smith, clearing the way for the franchise's move to Utah next season.

title: Olympic organizers unveil strategy for using artificial intelligence in sports
description: Olympic organizers unveiled their plans Friday to use artificial intelligence in sports, joining the global rush to capitalize on the rapidly advancing technology.

title: Resilience is one of Canadian women's soccer team's greatest assets as it looks to defend Olympic gold
description: It's been a challenging three years for the Canadian women's soccer team since they won the Olympic gold medal, but the resilience they demonstrate will serve them well in Paris.

title: Hockey Canada announces roster for world Para championship in Calgary
description: The Canadian team attempting to reclaim a world Para hockey championship on home ice was announced Thursday by Hockey Canada. Canada is the host team of the 2024 world championship May 4-12 in Calgary.

title: Canadian women earn 2nd straight blowout win over Spain at wheelchair basketball qualifier
description: Canada's women's wheelchair basketball team continued its strong start at the Paralympic qualifying tournament on Thursday in Osaka, Japan.
